channel.title: CVE Feed for Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd. -- Mate 10 pro
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd. -- Mate 10 pro

item.title: CVE-2018-7934|2024-08-05T06:37:59.577Z -- huawei%20technologies%20co.%2C%20ltd. -- mate%2010%20pro
item.description: Some Huawei mobile phone with the versions before BLA-L29 8.0.0.145(C432) have a denial of service (DoS) vulnerability because they do not adapt to specific screen gestures. An attacker may trick users into installing a malicious app. As a result, apps running on the frontend crash after the users make specific screen gestures.

item.title: CVE-2018-7936|2024-08-05T06:37:59.650Z -- huawei%20technologies%20co.%2C%20ltd. -- mate%2010%20pro
item.description: Mate 10 Pro Huawei smart phones with the versions before BLA-L29 8.0.0.148(C432) have a Factory Reset Protection (FRP) bypass security vulnerability. When re-configuring the mobile phone using the factory reset protection (FRP) function, an attacker can connect the phone with PC and send special instructions to install third party desktop and disable the boot wizard. As a result, the FRP function is bypassed.

item.title: CVE-2018-7989|2024-08-05T06:37:59.692Z -- huawei%20technologies%20co.%2C%20ltd. -- mate%2010%20pro
item.description: Huawei Mate 10 pro smartphones with the versions before BLA-AL00B 8.1.0.326(C00) have an improper authentication vulnerability. App Lock is a function to prevent unauthorized use of apps on smartphones, an attacker could directly change the lock password after a series of operations. Successful exploit could allow the attacker to use the application which is locked.
